sub_title: Analyst @PolisAnalysis | MSc Public Administration (International and European Governance) Graduate
summary:
Driven by curiosity and fueled by passion, I am a forward-thinking professional with a strong academic background and hands-on experience in International Studies and Public Administration. I bring a unique blend of analytical and research skills, problem-solving abilities, and exceptional communication acumen. With a keen eye for detail and a knack for finding innovative solutions, I thrive in fast-paced environments where creativity meets strategic thinking. As a team player who is not afraid to think outside the box, I am constantly seeking new challenges to broaden my horizons and make a meaningful impact.

I am known for my exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal, which allow me to effectively convey complex ideas and build meaningful relationships with diverse stakeholders. Constantly seeking to expand my skills and expertise, I am a firm believer in lifelong learning and continuously seek out professional development opportunities. Eager to seize new opportunities to contribute my skills and expertise, I am committed to making a positive and lasting impact in my field and beyond.

projects.title: The “Great Game of Geopolitics” in the Eastern Mediterranean Sea: Assessing the 2018 Energy Dispute between Turkey and the Republic of Cyprus and its Influence on Regional Cooperation
projects.description: Rising tensions and new cooperation tendencies in the Eastern Mediterranean area are highlighted by energy politics. Latest natural gas discoveries in the Eastern Mediterranean Sea have prompted many to wonder whether natural resources might help the area to reach peace and prosperity. However, the recent tensions and navy confrontations reveal that competition extends beyond the race for energy. By focusing on the 2018 energy dispute between the Republic of Cyprus (in alliance with Greece) and Turkey, this thesis paper examines the fluctuations of geopolitical strategies in the Eastern Mediterranean, as well as their influence on regional cooperation and the new foreign relations realities between the competing regional powers. What impact do regional and international powers' actions and policies have on regional security? Does the discovery of energy resources lead to closer cooperation or increased competition? This thesis paper looks beyond the economic importance of energy resources and analyses the energy problem in the Mediterranean Sea as primarily a geopolitical and strategic one, with economics playing a secondary role.

company.name: Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of Bulgaria

profile_positions.company: Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of Bulgaria
profile_positions.description:
As an Intern at the Political Section of the Embassy, my main tasks included:
• Sourcing and drafting the Embassy’s daily press summary by reviewing the daily press and governmental documents.
• Providing organisational and administrative support to the Ambassador and Consular’s Offices (drafting diplomatic cables, reporting and summarising on relevant topics, replying to letters and emails).
• Assisting in the organisation of events, as well as representing the Embassy at various conferences and seminars.
profile_positions.title: Intern at the Embassy of the Republic of Bulgaria in the Netherlands

company.name: InsSciDe (Inventing a shared Science Diplomacy for Europe)

profile_positions.company: InsSciDe (Inventing a shared Science Diplomacy for Europe)
profile_positions.description:
InsSciDE is a Horizon 2020-funded project concentrating on the building of a shared European science diplomacy via transnational and multidisciplinary research. As a Project Assistant for InsSciDE, my main tasks included:
• Increasing the project's publicity.
• Releasing news and policy content on science diplomacy.
• Arranging the project's Concluding Conference in Paris. 
• Tracking the project's impact by co-authoring an impact assessment report to the European Commission.
profile_positions.title: Project Assistant

profile_positions.description: As an volunteer at the Changemakers Program, I had the opportunity to be part of a support platform for human rights defenders and peace advocates.
profile_positions.title: Volunteer Changemakers Program

profile_positions.description: Working on a real-life consultancy project on the protection of underwater cultural heritage in a team of ten people. Tasks include researching, data gathering and writing to provide the partner organisation with valuable practical recommendations based on solid scientific research.
profile_positions.title: Academic Consultant

profile_positions.description:
As an Intern at the European Academy of Diplomacy, my main tasks included: 
• Coordinating internal and external resources.
• Ensuring that projects remained within scope, schedule, and defined budgets. 
• Searching for interesting trainers and specialists for the Academy's new programs.
profile_positions.title: Grants Department Intern

profile_positions.description:
As a Part-Time Sales Assistant at ZARA, my main tasks included:
• Locating products for customers, place orders, place holds, process transactions and keep the sales floor organized and well-stocked.
• Developing further my organisational, communication, and teamwork skills.
profile_positions.title: Sales Assistant

profile_positions.description:
As a Student Assistant at the Career Centre of the Faculty of Humanities, my main tasks included:
• Assisting in the preparation of corona-proof internship opportunities by facilitating Regional COVID-19 Advisory Teams. 
• Coordinating and expanding the Humanities Career Service's internship base.
• Participating in the establishment of a network between employers and the Career Service for future internship opportunities for students.
profile_positions.title: Student Assistant

profile_positions.description: As a booklet writer at Athena Studies, I had the opportunity to assist in the preparation of study plans for students within the International Studies programme. My tasks included: reading, analysing and summarising the related examination material for the course Cultural Interaction: Conflict and Cooperation.
profile_positions.title: Booklet Writer

profile_positions.description: As a tutor at Athena Studies, my main responsibilities included: assisting in the drawing up of lesson plans to help students and keep track of their exams. Moreover, I had the opportunity to participate in the creation of teaching materials in various academic subjects, with the aim of helping students to improve their grades from various exams.
profile_positions.title: Tutor

profile_positions.company: College Life - Global Hub for International Students & Graduates
profile_positions.description: As a Global Community Moderator, I was responsible for growing and maintaining the community of College Life through its social media accounts - Facebook, LinkedIn.
profile_positions.title: Global Community Moderator

profile_positions.company: College Life - Global Hub for International Students & Graduates
profile_positions.description:
College Life is a hub for international students & graduates. As a Community Leader, I played an essential role in building the College Life community within The Hague, Netherlands. 

My main tasks included: creating a community for an international brand; consistently meeting international expansion targets; conducting market research for the local market (mainly through Facebook and LinkedIn).
profile_positions.title: Community Lead

volunteer_experiences.description: BETA Europe is a politically independent and non-profit association, seated in Brussels, with national branches in 16 countries, among which is BETA Bulgaria. The expression of its goal is to actively support such political simulations as the Model European Union (MEU), events which allow young people to engage in politics and discover the founding principles behind Europe through a first hand experience of the democratic process.

As an Amnesty International Student Group member, I had the chance to explore the work of Amnesty International, take action for human rights together with other students, organise demonstrations, actions, debates, social activities and most importantly, raise awareness for human rights issues of my interest.

ESN The Hague is the city-section of the largest student network in Europe, the ‘’Erasmus Student Network’’, offering services to over 350.000 members in 41 countries. ESN acts for the creation of a mobile and flexible educational environment.

Bachelor Students of International Studies (BASIS) is the study association for BA International Studies. The main goals of BASIS are to increase academic knowledge pertaining to the course and to increase the social cohesion between the members of the association. To accomplish this, BASIS offers a variety of activities, both social and academic.

DiscoverEU is an initiative of the European Union that gives you the opportunity to discover Europe through learning experiences. As a #DiscoverEU Ambassador, I was invited to share my travel experiences through social media tools - Instagram, Facebook and/or Twitter - using #DiscoverEU.

The project aims to acquaint young people with Bulgaria’s national priorities in the field of foreign policy, and in particular – the activities of NATO and Bulgaria’s contribution to the collective security and defence system.

volunteer_experiences.description: A section within the framework of the Ministry of Interior. The National Comission for Combating Trafficking in Human Beings is the Bulgarian representative in the Network of Anti-Trafficking Coordinators of South-Eastern Europe.

UNICEF works in the most difficult places to reach the most vulnerable children. To save their lives. To protect their rights. To help them realize their potential. UNICEF works for every child, everywhere, every day - in over 190 countries and territories - to create a better world for everyone.
